items.title: ‘Nobody’s Trying to Help Him’: Deaths in Cuyahoga County Jail Intensify Scrutiny
items.description: Videos depicting two men’s final moments, and the response by guards, raise alarms at the embattled jail where at least 24 people have died since 2018...

items.title: What Will Trump’s Executive Order on Private Prisons Really Do?
items.description: The order reverses Biden’s ban on private prison contracts with the Justice Department. Private immigrant detention never stopped and is expected to g...

items.title: Trump’s New Order to Expand the Death Penalty Misses Key Details
items.description: The order shows the president’s desire for more executions. But it’s unclear how the administration will carry out its plans, legal experts say.

items.title: Why Firing the Prison Guards Involved in Robert Brooks’ Death Is Neither Quick Nor Easy
items.description: Our investigation in 2023 exposed how New York’s discipline system failed to hold abusive guards to account.

items.title: Incarcerated Firefighters Do Risky, Low-Pay Work. Many Say It’s The Best Job Behind Bars.
items.description: More than 900 prison firefighters were responding to the crisis in Los Angeles — but their pay is low and the ethics of their choice are complicated.
